com.radirius.mercury.graphics

Interface Batcher

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VAOBatcher

    public interface Batcher
    An abstraction for batchers.
    Author:
    wessles, Sri Harsha Chilakapati

        Parameters:

            float y,

        Parameters:

        y - The y position.
        u - The x texture coordinate.
        v - The y texture coordinate.

      • vertex

        void vertex(float x,
            float y,
            Color color,
            float u,
            float v)
        Adds a vertex to the stack.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position.
        y - The y position.
        color - The color of the vertex.
        u - The x texture coordinate.
        v - The y texture coordinate.

      • vertex

        void vertex(float x,
            float y,
            float r,
            float g,
            float b,
            float u,
            float v)
        Adds a vertex to the stack.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position.
        y - The y position.
        r - The red value of color of the vertex.
        g - The green value of color of the vertex.
        b - The blue value of color of the vertex.
        u - The x texture coordinate.
        v - The y texture coordinate.

      • vertex

        void vertex(float x,
            float y,
            float r,
            float g,
            float b,
            float a,
            float u,
            float v)
        Adds a vertex to the stack.
        Parameters:
        x - The x position.
        y - The y position.
        r - The red value of color of the vertex.
        g - The green value of color of the vertex.
        b - The blue value of color of the vertex.
        a - The alpha value of color of the vertex.
        u - The x texture coordinate.
        v - The y texture coordinate.

      • flushOnOverflow

        void flushOnOverflow(int allocate)
        Will flush the data to OpenGL if the sum of the vertex count and the allocation is higher than the limit.
        Parameters:
        allocate - The amount of vertices that will be rendered in the next vertex-group.

      • getVerticesLastRendered

        int getVerticesLastRendered()
        Returns:
        The amount of vertices rendered last render frame.

      • cleanup

        void cleanup()
        Cleanup any used resources like OpenGL buffers
